summary: This document is a chain of emails from February 2020 between attorneys and investigators regarding the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss scheduling interviews with a victim (referred to as 'M'), coordinating with her legal team, and planning investigative steps including contacting family members and other witnesses. The correspondence reveals active civil litigation and media coverage related to a new accuser.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP representing a victim (referred to as 'M') in a civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein. He is coordinating interview schedules and investigative steps with the SDNY investigation team.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.context: Copied on all emails, appears to be part of the investigation team coordinating with Robert Glassman regarding interviews and the SDNY investigation.

persons.name: Kevin Boyle
persons.context: Copied on several emails as part of the investigation team working on the SDNY Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the SDNY investigation and civil lawsuit for alleged sexual abuse of a minor.

persons.name: John Koeltl
persons.context: Identified as the judge assigned to the civil lawsuit filed by the victim.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Identified as the magistrate judge assigned to the civil lawsuit.

persons.name: Moskowitz
persons.context: Mentioned as having already reached out to Robert Glassman's legal team regarding the case.

persons.name: Howie Simon
persons.context: Identified by the victim as a contact that investigators wanted to reach out to for the investigation.

persons.name: Dr. Cabe
persons.context: Identified by the victim as a contact that investigators wanted to reach out to for the investigation.

persons.name: John Larkin
persons.context: Identified by the victim as a contact that investigators wanted to reach out to for the investigation.

connections.description: Robert Glassman is the attorney representing the victim referred to as 'M' in a civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein.
Frequent email correspondence regarding scheduling interviews and coordinating the SDNY investigation involving the victim.
Both copied on investigation-related emails discussing interview scheduling and case coordination.
Both appear to be part of the same investigation team working on the SDNY Epstein case.
The victim is accusing Jeffrey Epstein of sexual abuse that occurred when she was 13 years old.

events.title: Civil lawsuit filing
events.description: Robert Glassman files a civil lawsuit on behalf of a victim against Jeffrey Epstein, which gets media coverage.

events.title: Media coverage of lawsuit
events.description: Multiple news outlets (Daily News, NY Post, The Sun, Daily Mail) publish stories about the new Epstein accuser who claims she was abused at age 13.

events.title: Meeting with victim and attorneys
events.description: Scheduled meeting between the investigation team, Robert Glassman, and the victim to discuss case details including travel specifics and conduct by Epstein/Maxwell.

events.title: Proposed interview with victim
events.description: Investigation team attempts to schedule an interview with the victim for February 19, 2020, or surrounding days.

keyFacts: A new civil lawsuit was filed against Jeffrey Epstein in January 2020 by a victim represented by attorney Robert Glassman.
The victim alleges Epstein sexually abused her when she was 13 years old and told her to wear children's underwear.
The investigation team was actively planning to interview the victim's family members including her mother, siblings, and other contacts (Howie Simon, Dr. Cabe, John Larkin) for corroboration.
The case was assigned to Judge John Koeltl and Magistrate Judge Barbara Moses in the SDNY.
The victim's mother was reportedly overseas (not in the US) at the time of the investigation.
